# Description of DataSchema variable 

* Short name: `adl_dressing`
* Variable label: `ADL-Difficulties for getting dressed`
* Domain: `Health status and functional limitations`
* Value type: `categorical`
* Category coding:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
0        | yes
1        | no

* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing




<!-- ########################################################## --> 

# Data process

```{r, dataDirectory, echo=FALSE}
datafolder <- "../RData"
``` 

## aksst 
### Wave 1

#### Study-specific variable description

 


* Name: `d_013_1`
* Label: `D-013-1:DIFFICULTY PUTTING ON YOUR SOCKS`
* Categories:
    + `1 Yes (Has difficulty)`
    + `0 No`
* Missings
    + `NA`

* Description: 
```{r assign 5 cities w1,  echo=FALSE}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'JSTAR_5cities_w1_adl_dressing','JSTAR_datasets_restricted.jstar_2007_5cities', variables=list('d_013_1'), missings = TRUE)
```

```{r local 5 cities w1,  echo=FALSE}
JSTAR_5cities_w1_adl_dressing <- opal.execute(o,'JSTAR_5cities_w1_adl_dressing')
vari <- JSTAR_5cities_w1_adl_dressing$d_013_1 # VARIABLE
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = attributes(vari)$`spss::shortName`)
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
#Categorical_summary(JSTAR_5cities_w1_adl_dressing$d_013_1)
ggplot(JSTAR_5cities_w1_adl_dressing, aes(x=factor(d_013_1))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("ADL - Difficulty getting dressed") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute the harmonize variable from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `1 into 0` 
* `0 into 1` 
* `NA into 999`

**R script:** 
```{r harmo 5 cities w1,   echo=TRUE}
JSTAR_aksst_ds_w1 <- tibble(id=JSTAR_5cities_w1_adl_dressing$id)
JSTAR_aksst_ds_w1$adl_dressing <- car::recode(JSTAR_5cities_w1_adl_dressing$d_013_1, "0 = '1';1 = '0';NA = '999' ")
JSTAR_aksst_ds_w1$adl_dressing <- labelled(JSTAR_aksst_ds_w1$adl_dressing, labels = c(Yes=0, No=1,Missing=999, Do_not_know=998, Refuse=997, Not_applicable=996, Does_not_answer=995,  Not_attempt_not_done=994, Disable_to_measure=993, Impute=992, CAPI_interviewer_error=991))
```

#### Statistical description of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript 5 cities w1,  echo=FALSE}
vari <- JSTAR_aksst_ds_w1$adl_dressing # variable you want to descrive
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[3])
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[2], caption = "Type of missing")
#Categorical_summary(var = JSTAR_aksst_ds_w1$adl_dressing, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999, 999))
ggplot(JSTAR_aksst_ds_w1, aes(x=factor(adl_dressing))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("ADL - Difficulty getting dressed") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Validation
```{r crosstabulation 5 cities w1,  echo=FALSE}
AfterH <- table(JSTAR_aksst_ds_w1$adl_dressing)
X<-table(JSTAR_5cities_w1_adl_dressing$d_013_1)
BeforeH <- c(X[2:1],sum(is.na(JSTAR_5cities_w1_adl_dressing$d_013_1)))
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("1->0","0->1","NA->999") 
kable(C)
```

 
 


 
```{r importOPAL 5 cities w1, echo=FALSE,  echo=FALSE}
val_labels(JSTAR_aksst_ds_w1) <- NULL
label(JSTAR_aksst_ds_w1$adl_dressing) <- "Difficulties for getting dressed"
#opal.assign.data(o, 'JSTAR_aksst_ds_w1', JSTAR_aksst_ds_w1)
#opal.symbol_import(o,'JSTAR_aksst_ds_w1', project='_Athlos_Harm_Dataset')

JSTAR_m_aksst_ds_w1 <- JSTAR_aksst_ds_w1
JSTAR_m_aksst_ds_w1$adl_dressing <- car::recode(JSTAR_m_aksst_ds_w1$adl_dressing, "c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997,998, 999)=NA")
#opal.assign.data(o, 'JSTAR_m_aksst_ds_w1', JSTAR_m_aksst_ds_w1)
#opal.symbol_import(o,'JSTAR_m_aksst_ds_w1', project='_Athlos_Harm_Dataset')
```


```{r,  echo=FALSE}
adl_dressing <- JSTAR_aksst_ds_w1
save(adl_dressing, file = paste0(datafolder, "/aksst_w1/adl_dressing.RData"))
```
